Posts.Content: pam43525 wrote: BMX was Sept 22nd.  Had 4 drainage tubes that didn't seem to want to stop draining.  My last tube was taken out due to losing pressure in the bulb - it still drained 80 cc per day.  That afternoon I felt something wet rolling down my side.  The fluid had found a weak spot in the incision and opened it about 1 1/2 inches.  My BS said to delay putting in the port and chemo until this is healed.  I've been taping maxi-pads to my chest over that stupid hole.  It's been a week and no change in the hole or the output.  I go back to the BS tomorrow.  Anyone else have this?  How long will thus take?  My onc is getting impatient to start chemo. Dx 8/6/2014, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 9/22/2014 Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: surgery 6 weeks ago, still waiting to start chemo. pam43525 Scwilly

Posts.Content: pam43525 wrote: I was scheduled for the lymphoscintigraphy on Monday 9/22 at 9:00, followed by a bilateral mastectomy at 11:00.  Has anyone had it done this way?  I am really tired of painful procedures and am hoping this is a piece of cake... Dx 8/6/2014, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 9/22/2014 Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sentinel node biopsy - help quickly please!!! pam43525 Ariom
